meanings.definition: To eat improperly or in a disorderly manner.
meanings.sent1: She always misseats by talking with her mouth full.
meanings.sent2: He tends to misseat when he is in a hurry.
meanings.sent3: The dog misseated by trying to eat his food and play with a toy at the same time.
meanings.sent4: The toddler misseated his spaghetti, creating a messy masterpiece on the table.
meanings.sent5: The students learned not to misseat during the etiquette class.

meanings.definition: The act of consuming food in a careless or incorrect way.
meanings.sent1: Misseating can lead to digestive problems.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised him to avoid misseating to maintain a healthy diet.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a skit about the consequences of misseating at a fancy restaurant.
meanings.sent4: Her misseating at the buffet was like a whirlwind of chaos on her plate.
meanings.sent5: The book highlighted the importance of proper eating habits to prevent misseating.
